intro: Scheidweileria sellowiana, commonly known as the Sowbug plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low-growing habit and produces flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Scheidweileria sellowiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
